intro: Geraniospermum pinnatifidum, commonly known as the narrowleaf geraniospermum, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
